detaileddescription.para: Baudrate generator clock divider: Normal mode
Baudrate generator clock divider: Fractional mode
USIC channel baudrate generator divider mode
Baudrate generator clock source : Source divider. (Internal clock source)
Baudrate generator clock source : DX1T. (External clock source)
Baudrate generator clock source : DX1S. (External clock source)
USIC channel baudrate generator clock source
USIC channel input selection for CTQ
Baudrate generator master clock passive level(idle mode signal level) 0
Baudrate generator master clock passive level((idle mode signal level)) 1
USIC channel baudrate generator master clock passive level
Baudrate generator shift clock output: SCL.(Internally generated shift clock)
Baudrate generator shift clock output: DX1. (External input shift clock)
USIC channel baudrate generator shift clock output
Shift clock passive level 0, delay disabled
Shift clock passive level 1, delay disabled
Shift clock passive level 0, delay enabled
Shift clock passive level 1, delay enabled
USIC channel baudrate generator shift clock passive level
Use fperiph frequency for input source sampling
Common mask for SFSEL bitfield position in DXnCR register Use fFD(fractional divider) frequency for input source sampling
USIC channel input source sampling frequency
Node pointer for transmit shift interrupt
Node pointer for transmit buffer interrupt
Node pointer for alternate receive interrupt
Node pointer for protocol related interrupts
Stop mode 0 (no transmission, but reception possible)
Stop mode 1 (both transmission and reception not possible)
USIC channel output signal passive data level
RBUF0 data has not yet been read out
RBUF1 data has not yet been read out
USIC channel receive FIFO event configuration
Node pointer for FIFO standard receive interrupt
Node pointer for FIFO alternative receive interrupt
USIC channel receive FIFO interrupt node pointers
Shift LSB first. The first data bit of a data word is located at bit position 0.
Shift MSB first. The first data bit of a data word is located at the bit position given by the configured word length.
USIC channel shift direction. Defines the shift direction of the data words for transmission and reception
Passive data level is sent out on transmission.
Transmission of the data word in TBUF can be started if TDV = 1
Transmission of the data word in TBUF can be started if TDV = 1 while DX2S_0
Transmission of the data word in TBUF can be started if TDV = 1 while DX2S_1

USIC channel data transmission start modes. Data shifted out of the transmit pin depends on the value configured for the TDEN bitfield of the TCSR register. Following enum values are used for configuring the TCSR->TDEN bitfield.
Set Transfer buffer status to busy
Set Transfer buffer status to idle
USIC channel data transmit buffer status modification
USIC channel data transmit buffer status
USIC channel transmit FIFO event configuration
Node pointer for FIFO standard transmit interrupt
Node pointer for transmit FIFO error interrupt
USIC channel transmit FIFO interrupt node pointers

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const uint16_t pdiv, const uint32_t oversampling, const XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_COMBINATION_MODE_t combination_mode)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_ConfigExternalInputSignalToBRG

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Desired divider for the external frequency input. Range: minimum value = 1, maximum value = 1024

Required oversampling. The value indicates the number of time quanta for one symbol of data. This can be related to the number of samples for each logic state of the data signal. Range: 1 to 32. Value should be chosen based on the protocol used.
Selects which edge of the synchronized(and optionally filtered) signal DXnS actives the trigger output DXnT of the input stage.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Enables the external frequency input for the Baudrate Generator and configures the divider, oversampling and the combination mode of the USIC channel.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_SHIFT_CLOCK_PASSIVE_LEVEL_t passive_level, const XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_SHIFT_CLOCK_OUTPUT_t clock_output)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_ConfigureShiftClockOutput

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

Passive level for the clock output. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_SHIFT_CLOCK_PASSIVE_LEVEL_0_DELAY_DISABLED, XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_SHIFT_CLOCK_PASSIVE_LEVEL_0_DELAY_ENABLED, XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_SHIFT_CLOCK_PASSIVE_LEVEL_1_DELAY_DISABLED, XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_SHIFT_CLOCK_PASSIVE_LEVEL_1_DELAY_ENABLED,
Shift clock source selection. Range: Use XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_SHIFT_CLOCK_OUTPUT_SCLK, XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_SHIFT_CLOCK_OUTPUT_DX1

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Sets the idle mode shift clock output level and selects the shift clock source.
Shift clock idle mode output level can be set to logic high or low. Shift clock output can be configured to have a delay of half shift clock period. Both the configurations are available as enumeration values defined with type XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_SHIFT_CLOCK_PASSIVE_LEVEL_t. This value should be configured based on the slave device requirement. Shift clock source can be selected between internal clock(master) and external input(slave).

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
USIC channel input stage of type XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_t. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX0 to XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX5

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
The input of the data shift unit is connected to the selected data input line.
This setting is used if the signals are directly derived from an input pin without treatment by the protocol preprocessor.

inbodydescription.para: < Common mask for INSW bitfield mask in DXnCR register

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
USIC channel input stage of type XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_t. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX0 to XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX5

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The input of the data shift unit is controlled by the protocol pre-processor.

inbodydescription.para: < Common mask for INSW bitfield mask in DXnCR register

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Disables the USIC channel.
USIC channel is disabled by setting the module enable bit(MDEN) to 0 in the register KSCFG.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

Bit mask of the channel events to be disabled. Use XMC_USIC_CH_EVENT_t for the bit masks. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_EVENT_RECEIVE_START, XMC_USIC_CH_EVENT_DATA_LOST etc. Multiple events can be combined using OR operation.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Disable the channel interrupt events.
Multiple events can be combined using the bitwise OR operation and configured in one function call. XMC_USIC_CH_EVENT_t enumerates multiple protocol event bitmasks. These enumerations can be used as input to the API.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Disables automatic update of frame length.
When automatic update of frame length is disabled, frame length has to configured explicitly. Frame length remains fixed until it is changed again.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
USIC channel input stage of type XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_t. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX0 to XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX5

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Disables the input digital filter for USIC channel input data signal.
Input data signal from the selected multiplexer will not be digitally filtered.

inbodydescription.para: < Common mask for DFEN bitfield mask in DXnCR register

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
USIC channel input stage of type XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_t. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX0 to XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX5

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Disables input inversion for USIC channel.
Resets the input data polarity for the USIC channel input data signal.

inbodydescription.para: < Common mask for DPOL bitfield mask in DXnCR register

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
USIC channel input stage of type XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_t. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX0 to XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX5

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Disables input synchronization for the USIC channel input data signal.
Input data signal from the selected multiplexer will not be synchronized.

inbodydescription.para: < Common mask for DSEN bitfield mask in DXnCR register

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Disables the trigger of TDV depending on DX2T signal.
Bit TCSR.TE is permanently set.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Disables time measurement using the capture mode timer.
Time measurement is disabled by clearing the timer enable flag in BRG register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Disables automatic update of word length.
When automatic update of word length is disabled, word length has to configured explicitly. Word length remains fixed until it is changed again.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Enables the USIC channel.
USIC channel is enabled by setting the module enable bit in KSCFG register bitfield MODEN. On enabling, the channel is set to idle mode.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Enables delay compensation.
Delay compensation can be applied to the receive path.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

Bit mask of the channel events to be enabled. Use XMC_USIC_CH_EVENT_t for the bit masks. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_EVENT_RECEIVE_START, XMC_USIC_CH_EVENT_DATA_LOST etc. Multiple events can be combined using OR operation.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Enable the channel interrupt events.
Common channel events related to serial communication can be configured using this API. Multiple events can be combined using the bitwise OR operation and configured in one function call. XMC_USIC_CH_EVENT_t enumerates multiple protocol event bitmasks. These enumerations can be used as input to the API.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Enables automatic update of frame length.
When the automatic update of frame length is enabled, frame length is configured based on the index of the TBUF[]/IN[] register array. When the data is written to TBUF[x], frame length is configured with the mask value of x at the last 5 bit positions. Same logic is applicable if data is written to IN[x] register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
USIC channel input stage of type XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_t. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX0 to XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX5

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Enables the input digital filter for USIC channel input data signal.
Input data signal from the selected multiplexer will be digitally filtered.

inbodydescription.para: < Common mask for DFEN bitfield mask in DXnCR register

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
USIC channel input stage of type XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_t. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX0 to XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX5

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Enables input inversion for USIC channel input data signal.
Polarity of the input source can be changed to provide inverted data input.

inbodydescription.para: < Common mask for DPOL bitfield mask in DXnCR register

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
USIC channel input stage of type XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_t. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX0 to XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX5

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Enables input synchronization for the USIC channel input data signal.
Input data signal from the selected multiplexer will be synchronized with fPERIPH. A noisy signal can be synchronized and filtered by enabling the digital filter.

inbodydescription.para: < Common mask for DSEN bitfield mask in DXnCR register

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Bit TCSR.TE is set if DX2T becomes active while TDV = 1.
Enables the transfer trigger unit to set bit TCSR.TE if the trigger signal DX2T becomes active for event driven transfer starts.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Enables time measurement using the capture mode timer.
Time measurement is enabled by setting the timer enable flag in BRG register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Enables automatic update of word length.
When the automatic update of word length is enabled, word length is configured based on the index of the TBUF[]/IN[] register array. When the data is written to TBUF[x], word length is configured with the mask value of x at the last 5 bit positions. Same logic is applicable if data is written to IN[x] register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.para: baudrate currently used by USIC channel for .

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Calculates the current used baudrate (fCTQIN) of a USIC channel.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The value of the counter is captured if one of the trigger signals DX0T or DX1T are activated by the corresponding input stage.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.para: baudrate currently used by USIC channel.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Calculates the current used MCLK frequency of a USIC channel.

briefdescription.para: API to get receive buffer status.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.para: Status of data validity check for RBUF0 and RBUF1. Returned value should be masked with RDV0 and RDV1 bits to know the status. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_RBUF_STATUS_DATA_VALID0, XMC_USIC_CH_RBUF_STATUS_DATA_VALID1.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Checks if RBUF0 and RBUF1 have valid unread data.
It checks the bits RDV0 and RDV1 of the RBUFSR register. Returns the value of RBUFSR masked with bitmasks of RDV0 and RDV1. It can be used to decide whether 2bytes has to be read from RBUF or 1 byte. If both bitmasks XMC_USIC_CH_RBUF_STATUS_DATA_VALID0 and XMC_USIC_CH_RBUF_STATUS_DATA_VALID1 are set, then 2 bytes can be read from RBUF. If only either of them is set, then only one byte can be read from RBUF.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.para: baudrate currently used by USIC channel.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Calculates the current used SCLK frequency of a USIC channel.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.para: Stataus XMC_USIC_CH_TBUF_STATUS_IDLE if transmit buffer is free, XMC_USIC_CH_TBUF_STATUS_BUSY if transmit buffer is busy.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Gets transmit buffer status.
Status indicates whether the transmit buffer is free, or busy transmitting data. The status depends on the value of TDV flag in TCSR register. This status can be used while transmitting data. Transmit data when the transmit buffer status is XMC_USIC_CH_TBUF_STATUS_IDLE.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Modify TCSR.TDV and TCSR.TE to control the start of a data word transmission by software.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Receive FIFO events to be cleared. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_EVENT_STANDARD, XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_EVENT_ERROR, XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_EVENT_ALTERNATE.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Clears the receive FIFO event flags in the status register.
USIC channel peripheral does not clear the event flags after they are read. This API clears the events provided in the mask value. XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_EVENT enumeration can be used as input. Multiple events can be cleared by providing a mask value obtained by bitwise OR operation of multiple event enumerations.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const uint32_t data_pointer, const XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_SIZE_t size, const uint32_t limit)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_Configure

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Start position inside the FIFO buffer. Range: 0 to 63.
Required size of the receive FIFO. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_DISABLED, XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_SIZE_2WORDS.. XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_SIZE_64WORDS
Threshold of receive FIFO filling level to be considered for generating events. Range: 0 to size -1.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Configures the receive FIFO.
Receive FIFO is the subset of a common FIFO sized 64 words. This FIFO is shared between 2 channels of the USIC module. Each channel can share the FIFO for transmission and reception. data_pointer represents the start index in the common FIFO, from where received data can be put. size represents the size of receive FIFO as a multiple of 2. Since the FIFO is shared between 2 USIC channels, FIFO size should be carefully selected. A FIFO standard receive buffer event or alternative receive buffer event is generated when the FIFO filling level exceeds the limit value.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Events to be disabled. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_EVENT_CONF_STANDARD, XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_EVENT_CONF_ERROR, XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_EVENT_CONF_ALTERNATE.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Disables the selected interrupt events related to receive FIFO.
By disabling the interrupt events, generation of interrupt is stopped. User can poll the event flags from the status register using the API XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_GetEvent(). Event bitmasks can be constructed using the enumeration XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_EVENT_CONF. For providing multiple events, combine the events using bitwise OR operation.

detaileddescription.para:
channel
Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
event
Events to be enabled. Multiple events can be bitwise OR combined. XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_EVENT_CONF_t
None
Description
Enables the interrupt events related to transmit FIFO.
Event bitmasks can be constructed using the enumeration XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_EVENT_CONF_t. Multiple events can be enabled by providing multiple events in a single call. For providing multiple events, combine the events using bitwise OR operation.
Note: API only enables the events. For interrupt generation, interrupt node must be configured and NVIC node must be enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Clears the contents of receive FIFO.
Receive FIFO contents will be cleared and the filling level will be reset to 0.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.para: Value read from the receive FIFO. Range: 16bit data. Length of data depends on the word length configuration.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Gets data from the receive FIFO.
Receive FIFO should be read only if data is availble in the FIFO. This can be checked using the API XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_IsEmpty(). Receive FIFO error flag will be set if an attempt is made to read from an empty receive FIFO. To read all the received data, user should keep reading data until receive FIFO is empty.

detaileddescription.para:
channel
Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Status of standard receive buffer, alternative receive buffer and receive buffer error events. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_EVENT_STANDARD, XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_EVENT_ERROR, XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_EVENT_ALTERNATE.
Description
Gets the receive FIFO events' status.
Gives the status of receive FIFO standard receive buffer event, alternative receive buffer event and receive buffer error event. The status bits are located at their bitpositions in the TRBSR register in the returned value. User can make use of the XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_EVENT enumeration for checking the status of return value. The status can be found by using the bitwise AND operation on the returned value with the enumerated value.
Note: Event status flags should be cleared by the user explicitly.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.para: uint32_t Receive FIFO filling level. Range: minimum= 0(FIFO empty), maximum= receive FIFO size.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Gets the receive FIFO filling level.
For every word received, the filling level is incremented. The API gives the value of this filling level. The filling level is decremented when the data is read out of the receive FIFO.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.para: Status true if receive FIFO is empty, false if receive FIFO has some data.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Checks if receive FIFO is empty.
When the receive FIFO is empty, received data will be put in receive FIFO. When the last received word in the FIFO is read, FIFO empty flag is set. Any attempt to read from an empty receive FIFO will set the receive FIFO error flag.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.para: Status true if receive FIFO is full false if receive FIFO is not full.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Checks if receive FIFO is full.
When the receive FIFO filling level reaches the configured size, FIFO full flag is set. Any data received when the receive FIFO is full, is lost.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_INTERRUPT_NODE_POINTER_t interrupt_node, const uint32_t service_request)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_SetInterruptNodePointer

detaileddescription.para:
channel
Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
interrupt_node
Node pointer representing the receive FIFO events. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_INTERRUPT_NODE_POINTER_STANDARD, XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_INTERRUPT_NODE_POINTER_ALTERNATE
service_request
The service request to be used for interrupt generation. Range: 0 to 5.
None
Description
Sets an interrupt node for the receive FIFO events.
A node pointer represents one or more interrupt events. Service request represents the interrupt node to be used among the 6 interrupt nodes available for USIC module. API configures the service request to be used for interrupt generation for the events selected. A receive FIFO event can generate an interrupt only if the interrupt node is configured for the event and the interrupt generation is enabled for the event. For example, transmit FIFO standard transmit buffer interrupt is generated if the interrupt node for the same is set and interrupt is enabled.
Note: NVIC node should be explicitly enabled for the interrupt generation.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_SIZE_t size, const uint32_t limit)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_SetSizeTriggerLimit

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Required size of the receive FIFO. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_DISABLED, XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_SIZE_2WORDS.. XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_SIZE_64WORDS
Threshold for receive FIFO filling level to be considered for generating events. Range: 0 to size -1.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Sets the size and trigger limit for the receive FIFO.
The API is not to be called for initializing the receive FIFO. The API shall be used for the runtime change of receive FIFO trigger limit. FIFO start position will not be affected on execution.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Threshold for transmit FIFO filling level to be considered for generating events. Range: 0 to fifo size -1.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Sets the trigger limit for the TX FIFO.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

Desired baudrate. Range: minimum value = 100, maximum value depends on the peripheral clock frequency and oversampling. Maximum baudrate can be derived using the formula: (fperiph * 1023)/(1024 * oversampling)

Required oversampling. The value indicates the number of time quanta for one symbol of data. This can be related to the number of samples for each logic state of the data signal. Range: 1 to 32. Value should be chosen based on the protocol used.

simplesect.para: Status indicating the baudrate configuration. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_STATUS_OK if baudrate is successfully configured, XMC_USIC_CH_STATUS_ERROR if desired baudrate or oversampling is invalid.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Configures the baudrate of the USIC channel.
Baudrate is configured by considering the peripheral frequency and the desired baudrate. Optimum values of FDR->STEP and BRG->PDIV are calulated and used for generating the desired baudrate.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_CLOCK_SOURCE_t clksel, bool pppen, uint32_t pdiv, XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_CTQSEL_t ctqsel, uint32_t pctq, uint32_t dctq)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_SetBaudrateDivider

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Baudrate generator clock source.
Enable 2:1 Divider for fPPP.
Divider Factor to generate fPDIV = fPPP / (pDIV + 1)
Input selection for CTQ.
Pre-Divider for Time Quanta Counter. fCTQIN / (PCQT + 1)
Denominator for Time Quanta Counter. fTQ / (DCTQ + 1)

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Configures the baudrate generator of the USIC channel.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Desired baudrate. Only integer dividers of peripheral clock are achievable

Required oversampling. The value indicates the number of time quanta for one symbol of data. This can be related to the number of samples for each logic state of the data signal. Range: 1 to 32. Value should be chosen based on the protocol used.

simplesect.para: Status indicating the baudrate configuration. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_STATUS_OK if baudrate is successfully configured, XMC_USIC_CH_STATUS_ERROR if desired baudrate or oversampling is invalid.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Configures the baudrate of the USIC channel using the integer divider which restrics the achievable baudrate but decreses jitter.
Baudrate is configured by considering the peripheral frequency and the desired baudrate. Optimum values of FDR->STEP and BRG->PDIV are calulated and used for generating the desired baudrate.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
clock source for the BRG.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Sets the clock source for the BRG.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Data output mode. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_DATA_OUTPUT_MODE_NORMAL, XMC_USIC_CH_DATA_OUTPUT_MODE_INVERTED

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Configures the mode for data output.
USIC channel can be configured to shift inverted data or direct data based on the input to the API.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_CLOCK_DIVIDER_MODE_t mode, const uint16_t step)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_SetFractionalDivider

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
divider mode XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_CLOCK_DIVIDER_MODE_t
divider XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_CLOCK_DIVIDER_MODE_NORMAL resulting divider = 1023 - step XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_CLOCK_DIVIDER_MODE_FRACTIONAL resulting divider = 1023 / step

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The fractional divider generates its output frequency fFD by either dividing the input frequency fPERIPH by an integer factor n or by multiplication of n/1024.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Number of bits in a frame. Range: minimum= 1, maximum= 0x3f. The maximum value for fixed frame size is 0x3f. e.g: For a frame length of 16, frame_length should be provided as 16.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Define the data frame length.
Set the number of bits to be serially transmitted in a frame. The frame length should be multiples of word length. If the value is set to 0x40, the frame length has to be controlled explicitly.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_t input, const XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_SAMPLING_FREQ_t sampling_freq)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_SetInputSamplingFreq

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support..
USIC channel input stage of type XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_t. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX0 to XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX5
Sampling frequency value of type XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_SAMPLING_FREQ_t.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Sets sampling frequency for USIC channel input data signal.

inbodydescription.para: < Common mask for SFSEL bitfield mask in DXnCR register

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_t input, const uint8_t source)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_SetInputSource

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
USIC channel input stage of type XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_t. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX0 to XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX5

Input source select for the input stage. The table below maps the enum value with the input channel.
0
DXnA
1
DXnB
2
DXnC
3
DXnD
4
DXnE
5
DXnF
6
DXnG
7
Always 1

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Selects the data source for USIC input stage.
Selects the input data signal source among DXnA, DXnB.. DXnG for the input stage. The API can be used for all the input stages like DX0CR, DX1CR etc.

inbodydescription.para: < Common mask for DSEL bitfield mask in DXnCR register
< Common mask for DSEL bitfield position in DXnCR register

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_t input, const XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_COMBINATION_MODE_t combination_mode)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_SetInputTriggerCombinationMode

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support..
USIC channel input stage of type XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_t. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX0 to XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_DX5
Combination mode value of type XMC_USIC_CH_INPUT_COMBINATION_MODE_t.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Selects which edge of the synchronized signal DXnS activates the trigger output DXnT of the input stage.

inbodydescription.para: < Common mask for CM bitfield mask in DXnCR register
< Common mask for CM bitfield position in DXnCR register

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const XMC_USIC_CH_INTERRUPT_NODE_POINTER_t interrupt_node, const uint32_t service_request)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_SetInterruptNodePointer

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Interrupt node pointer to be configured. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_INTERRUPT_NODE_POINTER_TRANSMIT_SHIFT, XMC_USIC_CH_INTERRUPT_NODE_POINTER_TRANSMIT_BUFFER etc.
Service request number. Range: 0 to 5.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Sets the interrupt node for USIC channel events.
For an event to generate interrupt, node pointer should be configured with service request(SR0, SR1..SR5). The NVIC node gets linked to the interrupt event by doing so. Note: NVIC node should be separately enabled to generate the interrupt.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Passive level for the master clock output. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_MASTER_CLOCK_PASSIVE_LEVEL_0, XMC_USIC_CH_BRG_MASTER_CLOCK_PASSIVE_LEVEL_1.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Sets the idle mode pin level for the master clock output.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
USIC channel operation mode. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_OPERATING_MODE_IDLE, XMC_USIC_CH_OPERATING_MODE_SPI, XMC_USIC_CH_OPERATING_MODE_UART, XMC_USIC_CH_OPERATING_MODE_I2S, XMC_USIC_CH_OPERATING_MODE_I2C.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Sets the USIC channel operation mode.
A USIC channel can support multiple serial communication protocols like UART, SPI, I2C and I2S. The API sets the input operation mode to the USIC channel.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Value of passive level for the channel. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_PASSIVE_DATA_LEVEL0, XMC_USIC_CH_PASSIVE_DATA_LEVEL1

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Set the passive data level of the output signal.
When the USIC channel transmit stage is idle, the output signal level stays at the configured passive level.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Number of bits to be configured for a data word. Range: minimum= 1, maximum= 16. e.g: For word length of 8, word_length should be provided as 8.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Sets the data word length in number of bits.
Sets the number of bits to represent a data word. Frame length should be a multiple of word length.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

Transmission mode to be enabled. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_START_TRANSMISION_DISABLED, XMC_USIC_CH_START_TRANSMISION_ON_TDV, XMC_USIC_CH_START_TRANSMISION_ON_TDV_DX2S_0, XMC_USIC_CH_START_TRANSMISION_ON_TDV_DX2S_1

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Configures data transmission.
The configuration affects the data shifted on the DOUT0 pin.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
clearing or setting the TDV flag.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Modify TCSR.TDV and TCSR.TE to control the start of a data word transmission by software.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Number of bits to be configured for a data word. Range: minimum= 1, maximum= 16. e.g: For word length of 8, word_length should be provided as 8.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Sets the data word length in number of bits.
Sets the number of bits to represent a data word. Frame length should be a multiple of word length.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
service request number of the event to be triggered. Range: 0 to 5.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Trigger a USIC interrupt service request.
When the USIC service request is triggered, the NVIC interrupt associated with it will be generated if enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Transmit FIFO events to be cleared. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_EVENT_STANDARD, XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_EVENT_ERROR.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Clears the transmit FIFO event flags in the status register.
USIC channel peripheral does not clear the event flags after they are read. This API clears the events provided in the mask value. XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_EVENT enumeration can be used as input. Multiple events can be cleared by providing a mask value obtained by bitwise OR operation of multiple event enumerations.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const uint32_t data_pointer, const XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_SIZE_t size, const uint32_t limit)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_Configure

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Start position inside the FIFO buffer. Range: 0 to 63.
Required size of the transmit FIFO. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_DISABLED, XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_SIZE_2WORDS.. XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_SIZE_64WORDS
Threshold of transmit FIFO filling level to be considered for generating events. Range: 0 to size -1.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Initializes the transmit FIFO.
Transmit FIFO is a subset of a common FIFO sized 64 words. This FIFO is shared between 2 channels of the USIC module. Each channel can share the FIFO for transmission and reception. data_pointer represents the start index in the common FIFO, from where transmit data can be put, for the selected USIC channel. size represents the size of transmit FIFO as a multiple of
Since the FIFO is shared between 2 USIC channels, FIFO size should be carefully selected. A FIFO standard transmit buffer event is generated when the FIFO filling level falls below the limit value.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Events to be disabled. XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_EVENT_CONF_t

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Disables the interrupt events related to transmit FIFO.
By disabling the interrupt events, generation of interrupt is stopped. User can poll the event flags from the status register using the API XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_GetEvent(). Event bitmasks can be constructed using the enumeration XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_EVENT_CONF_t. For providing multiple events, combine the events using bitwise OR operation.

detaileddescription.para:
channel
Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
event
Events to be enabled. Multiple events can be bitwise OR combined. XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_EVENT_CONF_t
None
Description
Enables the interrupt events related to transmit FIFO.
Event bitmasks can be constructed using the enumeration XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_EVENT_CONF_t. Multiple events can be enabled by providing multiple events in a single call. For providing multiple events, combine the events using bitwise OR operation. Events are configured in the TBCTR register.
Note: API only enables the events. For interrupt generation, interrupt node must be configured and NVIC node must be enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Clears the contents of transmit FIFO.
Transmit FIFO contents will be cleared and the filling level will be reset to 0.

detaileddescription.para:
channel
Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Status of standard transmit and transmit buffer error events. XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_EVENT_t
Description
Gets the transmit FIFO event status.
Gives the status of transmit FIFO standard transmit buffer event and transmit buffer error event. The status bits are located at their bit positions in the TRBSR register in the returned value. User can make use of the XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_EVENT_t enumeration for checking the status of return value. The status can be found by using the bitwise AND operation on the returned value with the enumerated value.
Note: Event status flags should be cleared by the user explicitly.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.para: Transmit FIFO filling level. Range: minimum= 0(FIFO empty), maximum= transmit FIFO size.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Gets the transmit FIFO filling level.
For every word written to the FIFO, filling level is updated. The API gives the value of this filling level.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.para: Status true if transmit FIFO is empty false if transmit FIFO has some data.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Checks if transmit FIFO is empty.
When the transmit FIFO is empty, data can be written to FIFO. When the last written word to the transmit FIFO is transmitted out of the FIFO, FIFO empty flag is set.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.

simplesect.para: Status true if transmit FIFO is full false if transmit FIFO is not full.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Checks if transmit FIFO is full.
When the transmit FIFO filling level reaches the configured size, FIFO full flag is set. User should not write to the FIFO when the transmit FIFO is full.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Data to be transmitted. Range: 16bit unsigned data. minimum= 0, maximum= 65535

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Writes data into the transmit FIFO.
The data provided is placed in the transmit FIFO. The transmit FIFO should be configured before calling this API.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const uint16_t data, uint8_t loc)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_PutDataEx

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Data to be transmitted. Range: 16bit unsigned data. minimum= 0, maximum= 65535
Input location.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Transmit data can be loaded to TBUF by software by writing to the transmit buffer input locations TBUFx (x = 00-31), consisting of 32 consecutive addresses. The data written to one of these input locations is stored in the transmit buffer TBUF. Additionally, the address of the written location is evaluated and can be used for additional control purposes. This 5-bit wide information (named Transmit Control Information TCI) can be used for different purposes in different protocols.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const uint16_t data, const uint32_t frame_length)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_PutDataFLEMode

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Data to be transmitted.
Frame length to be configured while transmitting the data. Range: minimum= 0, maximum= 31. e.g: For a frame length of 16, set frame_length as 15.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Writes data to the transmit FIFO in frame length control mode.
When frame length control is enabled for dynamic update of frame length, this API can be used. frame_length represents the frame length to be updated by the peripheral. frame_length is used as index for the IN[] register array.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const uint16_t data, const uint32_t frame_length)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_PutDataHPCMode

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Data to be transmitted.
Frame length to be configured while transmitting the data. Range: minimum= 0, maximum= 31. e.g: For a frame length of 16, set frame_length as 15.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Writes data to the transmit FIFO in hardware port control mode.
When hardware port control is enabled for dynamic update of frame length, this API can be used. frame_length represents the frame length to be updated by the peripheral. frame_length is used as index for the IN[] register array.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_INTERRUPT_NODE_POINTER_t interrupt_node, const uint32_t service_request)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_SetInterruptNodePointer

detaileddescription.para:
channel
Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
interrupt_node
Node pointer representing the transmit FIFO events. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_INTERRUPT_NODE_POINTER_STANDARD, XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_INTERRUPT_NODE_POINTER_ALTERNATE
service_request
The service request to be used for interrupt generation. Range: 0 to 5.
None
Description
Sets an interrupt node for the transmit FIFO events.
A node pointer represents one or more interrupt events. Service request represents the interrupt node to be used among the 6 interrupt nodes available for USIC module. API configures the service request to be used for interrupt generation for the events selected. A transmit FIFO event can generate an interrupt only if the interrupt node is configured for the event and the interrupt generation is enabled for the event. For example, transmit FIFO standard transmit buffer interrupt is generated if the interrupt node for the same is set and interrupt is enabled.
Note: NVIC node should be explicitly enabled for the interrupt generation.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_SIZE_t size, const uint32_t limit)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_SetSizeTriggerLimit

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Required size of the transmit FIFO. Range: XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_DISABLED, XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_SIZE_2WORDS.. XMC_USIC_CH_FIFO_SIZE_64WORDS
Threshold for transmit FIFO filling level to be considered for generating events. Range: 0 to size -1.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Sets the size and trigger limit for the transmit FIFO.
The API is not to be called for initializing the transmit FIFO. The API shall be used for the runtime change of transmit FIFO trigger limit. FIFO start position will not be affected on execution.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Threshold for transmit FIFO filling level to be considered for generating events. Range: 0 to fifo size -1.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Sets the trigger limit for the TX FIFO.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Data to be transmitted. Range: 16bit unsigned data. minimum= 0, maximum= 65535

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Writes data into the transmit buffer.
The data provided is placed in TBUF[0U].

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_USIC_CH_t *const channel, const uint16_t data, const uint32_t transmit_control_information)
memberdef.name: XMC_USIC_CH_WriteToTBUFTCI

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC channel handler of type XMC_USIC_CH_t Range: XMC_USIC0_CH0, XMC_USIC0_CH1 to XMC_USIC2_CH1 based on device support.
Data to be transmitted.
transmit control information to be configured while transmitting the data. Range: minimum= 0, maximum= 31.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Writes data to the transmit buffer in a control mode.
When the respective control mode is enabled , this API can be used.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC module handler of type XMC_USIC_t. Range: XMC_USIC0 to XMC_USIC2 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Disables the USIC module.
Disables the clock for the USIC module by following the clock disabling sequence for the selected device.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to USIC module handler of type XMC_USIC_t. Range: XMC_USIC0 to XMC_USIC2 based on device support.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
Enables the USIC module.
Enables the clock for the USIC module by following the clock enabling sequence for the selected device.

briefdescription.para: Universal Serial Interface Channel(USIC) driver for serial communication.

detaileddescription.para: The Universal Serial Interface Channel(USIC) module is a flexible interface module covering several serial communication protocols. A USIC module contains two independent communication channels named USICx_CH0 and USICx_CH1, with x being the number of the USIC module. The user can program, during run-time, which protocol will be handled by each communication channel and which pins are used. The driver provides APIs, configuration structures and enumerations to configure common features of multiple serial communication protocols.

USIC driver features:
Allows configuration of FIFO for transmit and receive functions.
Provides a structure type XMC_USIC_CH_t to represent the USIC channel registers in a programmer friendly format.
Allows configuration of automatic update for frame length, word length, slave select or slave address.
Allows transmission of data to FIFO using XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_PutData() and XMC_USIC_CH_TXFIFO_PutDataFLEMode()
Allows reading of received data in FIFO using XMC_USIC_CH_RXFIFO_GetData()
Allows configuration of baudrate using XMC_USIC_CH_SetBaudrate()
Provides API to trigger interrupts using XMC_USIC_CH_TriggerServiceRequest()
